column4: hello deFrysk, the tip worked fine! but do u know the file i can edit to type the line to execute?
does anybody know what file do i edit to put a command to execute in the boot of the OS?
but where is it? /dev? i'm a newbie in linux... and i'm trying to discover how it works, lol
if it's daemon installed in a package then it usually automatically starts
no dont put it in inittab.... it was a nerdly joke
ok, i thought i could edit it

the files in the path /etc/rc2.d, are like this: S99filename. if i want to start the teamspeak server, then i create a file in the init.d path called "teamspeak" with the command that will be executed... and after this, i call the file "teamspeak" in rc2.d with another file called S99teamspeak?
i'll try it here! Thanx for the help!!!
remember to make the script executable
cool... have a look at the debian site for more info on admin.. they got some good docs
yes... i'm interested in learn linux for servers, and things like this... i'm loving linux =)

again... thanx for the help! i'm brazilian and it's early here now... i spent all the night configuring my server and programming some systems! Be sure i'll be always here =) Knoledge is never too much! Thanx for the attention and good night/day there... here it's 6:45am =)
